summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office staff discussing travel approval and logistics for an upcoming trip to Stockholm, Sweden, to conduct an interview related to the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). The emails reveal bureaucratic frustrations with the travel booking system (E2), hotel per diem issues, and references to prior travel for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.role: Legal Assistant, Public Corruption, U.S. Attorney's Office
persons.context: Coordinates travel logistics, searches for hotels and flights within per diem for the Stockholm trip, and communicates with the team about booking issues.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: Approves travel requests for the Epstein investigation team for trips to Stockholm, Los Angeles, and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Cc'd on travel approval requests; likely involved in administrative or budgetary approvals for travel exceeding per diem.

persons.name: Cynthia Perez
persons.context: Cc'd on a travel approval request email from Edward Tyrrell.

persons.name: Jack
persons.context: Mentioned briefly as having a fever, requiring a prosecutor to leave a proffer session to care for him.

connections.description: Darlene reports travel logistics issues to Edward for approval, and Edward approves travel requests she helps facilitate.
Darlene mentions needing to email Michele for approval regarding hotel costs exceeding per diem.
Both are copied on multiple travel approval requests, indicating a working relationship within the office's administrative chain.

events.title: Planned Interview in Stockholm
events.description: The prosecution team plans to travel to Stockholm, Sweden, to conduct an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel to Stockholm
events.description: Planned departure from JFK to Stockholm for the interview trip, with layovers in Paris or London.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel for an interview (or interviews) in Los Angeles related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel for an interview in West Palm Beach, Florida, related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document references the Epstein investigation under case number 2018R01618, described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.'
Prosecutors were actively conducting international travel to Stockholm, Sweden, for an interview as part of the investigation in early 2020.
The email chain reveals significant bureaucratic hurdles and frustration with the government's E2 travel system, including incorrect hotel locations and prices higher than public booking sites.
Multiple prior trips for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach are referenced, indicating an ongoing, multi-location investigation.
The correspondence is among staff of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, showing the administrative side of the investigation.
